title: Move IsTestFile logic out of formatter_utils.go
description:
The `IsTestFile` function in `cmd/graph/formatters/common/formatter_utils.go` is misplaced. Test file detection is language-specific and sometimes framework-specific logic that doesn't belong in formatter utilities.

Current location: `cmd/graph/formatters/common/formatter_utils.go:46`

Problem:
- Test file detection depends on programming language conventions (e.g., `_test.go` for Go, `.test.ts` for TypeScript)
- Some languages have framework-specific conventions (e.g., `__tests__/` directory for Jest)
- Formatters should only be concerned with output formatting, not semantic analysis

Possible new locations:
- Language-specific parsers (each parser knows its own test conventions)
- Dependency graph builder (if test detection is needed during graph construction)

Acceptance criteria:
- `IsTestFile` removed from formatter_utils.go
- Logic moved to appropriate location (parser or graph builder)
- All existing functionality preserved

title: Highlight cyclic dependencies in rendered graph
description:
Add visual highlighting for cyclic dependencies when rendering dependency graphs. This will help users quickly identify circular references that may cause issues in their dependency structure.

Acceptance criteria:

- The cycle path should be clearly identifiable
- Works with both terminal and any graphical graph output
